title: Green Beans with Parsley and Garlic
introduction: Green Beans with Parsley and Garlic is a simple yet delightful dish showcasing the vibrant flavors of fresh herbs. The addition of fresh flat-leaf parsley gives the green beans a burst of color and freshness, making it a wonderful side dish for any meal. A hint of garlic enhances the flavor, and tossing in some grated lemon zest before serving can add an extra layer of brightness.
instructions: Snap off the stem ends of the green beans. Bring about 2 quarts of water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add the beans and salt to taste. Cook uncovered until the beans are crisp-tender, 4 to 5 minutes.
Drain the beans and pat them dry. (If you are not using them immediately, cool them under cold running water. Wrap the beans in a kitchen towel and leave at room temperature up to 3 hours.)
Just before serving, heat the oil with the garlic and parsley in a large pan over medium heat. Add the beans and a sprinkle of pepper. Toss gently 2 minutes until just hot. Serve hot.
variations: As a variation, give these beans a final toss in the skillet with some grated lemon zest before serving.
